title: DIGITAL SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS - Lecturer: Fabio Giglietto - A.Y. 2025/2026 - Uniurb
snippet: This page describes the 'Digital Social Network Analysis' course taught by Fabio Giglietto at the University of Urbino in the academic year 2025/2026. It outlines the course's learning objectives, program, and skills students will acquire related to analyzing digital social environments and data from social media.
description: This webpage from the University of Urbino describes the 'Digital Social Network Analysis' course taught by Fabio Giglietto in the academic year 2025/2026, detailing the course's learning objectives and curriculum focused on analyzing digital social environments and social media data.

title: Health Discourse Research Initiative
snippet: This page discusses MEAG's partnership with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to conduct research about mis/disinformation in global health. It mentions Fabio Giglietto's work at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, leading a team to identify coordinated link-sharing networks on Facebook, focusing on health information in Nigeria and India.
description: This page from mediaecosystems.org describes a research initiative about mis/disinformation in global health, funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. It mentions Fabio Giglietto's work at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, leading a team focused on identifying coordinated link-sharing networks related to health information on Facebook in Nigeria and India.

title: Cracking Open the European Newsfeed | Journal of Quantitative Description: Digital Media
snippet: This article, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto, Luca Rossi, and Giada Marino, discusses a study that quantifies trustworthy and untrustworthy links shared on Facebook in Germany, France, and Italy between 2019 and 2022. It observes a decline in the number of URLs and an increase in URLs from untrustworthy domains.
description: This article, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto, discusses a study on trustworthy and untrustworthy links shared on Facebook in Germany, France, and Italy between 2019 and 2022. It relates to his research areas of social media and disinformation.

Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article features an interview with Fabio Giglietto and his team at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, who coordinate Work Package 4 (WP4) within the vera.ai project. Their objective is to discover potentially problematic content in near-real-time by focusing on coordinated sharing behavior using social media analysis and network science methods.
description: This article on the vera.ai website features Fabio Giglietto and his team at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, discussing their work within Work Package 4, which focuses on identifying problematic content through social media analysis.
